review: Sindhi Sweets in sector 11 in Panchkula is very well located. It has a good variety of sweets aka mithai , bakery items , confectionery, Street food like gol gappa , papri chaat , bhel puris etc . Also it has a restaurant serving an  all vegetarian menu having indian , Chinese & continental menu having both starters and main course . Also has a good range of desserts and beverages . The interiors are well done , bright lit and elegant. The service staff is well mannered and efficient and the kitchen staff too is fast in their preparations and the dishes are well presented and well portioned.Vegetarian options: All vegetarian menu is available.Parking: Good parking space available in front of this business.Kid-friendliness: Pretty kids friendly place.

I recently visited Sindhi Sweets Panchkula with high hopes for a delightful culinary experience. However, my visit left much to be desired. The food quality was subpar, lacking the authentic flavors one would expect from cuisine. The so called navratri food was not at all recommended. Additionally, the service was incredibly slow, to the point where even requesting a spoon seemed like an arduous task. Overall, I was thoroughly disappointed with my experience and would hesitate to recommend this restaurant to others.

Visited the place with family friends to savour the south Indian dishes which we were told was best in the town.The entire experience was awesome. The food, the ambiance and the service. All was top class.We not only enjoyed Dosa, but also chole-bhature and ice creams.Highly recommend.

We went there for a friend's bday. The food was so delicious. Must try their honey chilli potato and manchurian & noodles. The drinks were good too, we got fresh lime and badaam milk. The staff was very polite amd provided top notch service. Overall, we had an amazing experience.

Me and my sister visited there for some snacking.We were out for shopping and after that we wanted to eat something yummy and not so heavy, so we decided to explore newly opened Sindhi Sweets at Sector 11.We tried their Rasmalai, Red velvet pastry, gajar ka halwa, veg puff and Bhalla papdi chaat.Everything looked nice and was served well.The seating area near chaat counter is where we sat. The restaurant looks nice and felt okay, but this seating near the chaat counter felt a bit dark. (Not lit enough)Out of all the things I tried, Gajar ka halwa and Veg puff tasted the best.Rasmalai had a flavour of milk powder/ condensed milk or custard mix.Red velvet wasn’t very fresh, it tasted okay.The chaat was also okay-ish taste wise.Gajar ka halwa on the other hand was really good and perfectly sweet. Veg puff also was flaky and tasted good.We had a nice experience altogether.They have large variety of cookies, gift packs and of course sweets, which look and taste good. :)

Sindhi Sweets -Sector-11, Panchkula. Serving the city since 1976, offers a delightful experience:Welcoming Ambience:Step into a warm and inviting atmosphere.Hygiene Excellence:Experience a spotless environment with no hygiene concerns.Delicious Vegetarian Cuisine:Indulge in a delectable array of vegetarian dishes.Varied Menu:Explore a diverse menu featuring ice creams, gift packs, dry fruits, sweets, snacks, and flowers bouquets.Party Gifting Solutions:Find everything you need for gifting at parties, from sweets to food items.Impeccable Cleanliness:Rest assured with well-maintained washrooms.Convenient Payment Options:Enjoy the ease of UPI payments and debit/credit card transactions.Courteous Staff:Interact with a friendly and well-behaved team.Online Ordering:For convenience, Sindhi Sweets is also available on Zomato and Swiggy for online orders.Overall, a delightful experience awaits yoVegetarian options: It is veg restaurant.Kid-friendliness: Lot of space available

Conveniently located in the sector 11 market, but parking can be a challenge here.Sindhi Sweets is a treat for people with a sweet tooth. Tried the rasmalai which was above average, though the serving size was decent. I only wish the syrup was little thicker and sweeter. The flavor at the Elante mall shop is far better!The gulab jamun was big and yumm and the rabdi was good.The service was quick and the people behind the counter are polite and helpful.The shop offers a huge variety of delicacies to choose from.Overall the place is great to satisfy your taste buds.

Sindhi sweets offers good variety in vegetarian options.Ordered their hyped chane bhature but didn't like it. Paani golgappa was also a disappointing dish here. Although chaats and sweets are much recommended here as they offer freshly prepared motichoor Desi ghee laddoos.Ambience is great.It mostly has heavy rush on weekends.Suggestion - They should add some more combo/ platter food options in their menu.Vegetarian options: This restaurant is pure vegetarian and offers large variety of veg options.
This is one of the best Sindhi sweets in tricity in terms of ambience. The places is quite open with separate sitting for full restaurant and a separate chaat corner.

Absolutely love Sindhi Sweets, and their new branch in Panchkula is no exception! Having frequented their Chandigarh branch, I can confidently say that the food here is among the best in town. From delectable sweets to savory snacks, they offer a wide variety of options to satisfy every craving. The service is top-notch, ensuring a pleasant dining experience every time. Whether you're in the mood for a quick snack or a hearty meal, Sindhi Sweets in Panchkula delivers deliciousness with every bite. Highly recommended!Wheelchair accessibility: We did not find it wheelchair accessible. But then there are only 5-7 steps to enter the restaurant.

Incorrect bill prepared and didn't refund even after acknowledgement. Cashier told it's my (as customer) wish to come back or not.I told during dinner booking about my payment details but cashier miss (5000/- approx bill) and said he can't do anything,I need to pay.Do not recommend to visit such place. Better to visit other dining options

This was my second visit to the restaurant and I'm disappointed. First, I ordered manchurian dry which was sweet, I complained but no one was bothered. Second, French fries were not salty. Butter paneer masala was sweet. Now coming to the atmosphere, I feel on Saturdays and Sundays, as if they're giving free food. People waiting in ques to get their chance. The least you wanna do is wait for your food. Even after paying on the higher side you're not getting quality food. Not going again.P. S. The sweet shop is good

Surprisingly the food was horrible when we dined for breakfast last Saturday.The so hyped Chole Bhature were super disappointing, rather the aloo ki sabji given along was better than Chole itself.We had ordered Masala Dosa, Rava Paneer dosa - insane.Who adds coriander leaves in masala dosa - needs good training there. We were group of 10 and none of us could finish individual dishes that were ordered.The great thing was Sweet lassi which we liked and above expectation. But guys your food quality has gone down so bad that we won’t dine ever there. I’m shocked to still think of so worse Chole Bhature.. ideally that must be your signature item on the menu. And when I’m writing this, trust that I’m a food connoisseur and know versatility of food. Your production team needs a real hard work.Service was good and appreciation to them.Genuine feedback by a hotelier.
Such a lovely atmosphere and Mr. Mahesh service was cherry on the top seriously, your engagement with customer matters and food was really good too..
This place is so familiar and comfortable for customers. I referred this place for every type of food. Sweets, gift packs and flower 🌼 also.
The food was overpriced as the price and quantity were not proportionateThe chaat and desert were comparitively still really niceThe service and atmosphere was decent as well

This cozy restaurant has left the best impression on me and my friends, we went there for an official dinner , we all are from HDFC Bank.  Hospitable hosts , delicious food , beautiful presentation , very good staff, we met there with Naresh Kumar, he helped us with the selection of food,  we all were well attended by him.The place was very neat and clean, a place worth visiting, value for money. I love it , thank you for the wonderful evening.

Sindhi sweets has been an all time favorite since my childhood. Not just the food but the ambience is also amazing. I would like to mention the amazing customer service skills of Amit ji at the Sector 11 Panchkula outlet. He is extremely pleasant to chat with and has a positive vibe which is very contagious.He is a vital asset to the brand and people like him ensure to always go above and beyond. I would urge the management to notice his efforts and ensure he is also looked after well, in the same way he ensures to look after the customers.
Food was amazing and Service was phenomenal.Loved every bit of this place.Keep up the good work Sindhi Sweets.

The food was good..nice place to be there with family and friends... sindhi's special channa bhatura and 😋 🍬 🍫 With a welcoming ambiance and attentive staff, you'll feel right at home. The sweets are perfect combination of flavors and textures. The generous portion size ensures a satisfying quality, Don't miss this delicious experience in sidhi sweets 😋

Recently I visited SINDHI SWEETS, which is located in sector 11, Panchkula. I was really excited to taste amazing food.So I tried their Chana Bhature - which was super delicious. Then I tried their Raj Kachori, which was full of yumminess. Then we ordered mango lassi and vada.Mango lassi was really yumm.I didn't like the taste of Vada as Vada's flavor was just filled with black pepper only. So BIG NO to their Vada. But I will definitely gonna try their more food.Chana Bhatura  5⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (Must try)Raj Kachori  5⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐Mango Lassi  4.5⭐⭐⭐⭐Vada 1⭐Quality and quantity of food - Really Good.Gret staff and Service was excellent.Beautiful and fancy Ambience. Highly recommended.Overall great experience 👍 see you soon.
The food quality is going bad to worst.Too much oily food and no one to listen to our complaints or to even bother about the same.Please have a good chef and always put your customers on priority.

Disappointing Experience with Kulfi Faluda.I recently visited Sindhi Sweets in Sector 11, Panchkula, and ordered their Kulfi Faluda. Unfortunately, the dessert was a disappointment. It was overloaded with roohafza syrup, making it excessively sweet and overpowering in flavor. The taste was not to our liking at all. We were expecting a more balanced and enjoyable dessert experience, but this fell short of our expectations. Hopefully, the quality improves in the future."

No one can beat the quality of sweets of Sindhi Sweets. Firstly,we ordered paneer masala dosa...it wasn't crisp .... therefore, quality can be improved. Secondly, amritsari stuffed  kulcha was not crisp in the manner it should actually be. Quantity of channa should  be increased.
Sindhi sweets is one the finest family restaurant . They serving quality and delicious food for ages . They recently opened up in Panchkula.This outlet is one of the biggest sweets shop in town .

Pathetic Service. I ordered one Paneer Butter Masala for packing at 2:51 pm today. I was told that the wait time is 10 mins. It's been 3:15 pm and I am waiting. The main thing to note here is after my order, around 7-8 Zomato orders were picked by Zomato delivery guys who came after me. If Zomato is priority, then pls put a board on your eatery entry that WE DON'T VALUE CUSTOMERS WHO COME FOR TAKE AWAY ORDERS.
Their Navratri special thali is a fraud. It does not serve even one person. Quantity wise it’s too small but quality is good. Need to improve on the quantity front

Sindhi sweets ka experience bilkul bhi acha nhi tha waiting 1 hour ki thi esliye hm waps aa gye. Hr bar esa hi hota h. Ab sindhi sweets pr hmesha k liy  cut h. Log pta nhi etni waiting kaise krte hn. Bad experience.

Great place to eat. I really loved this place. The staffs are great and food is very tasty.   one of the most hygienic place for your street food and sweet tooth cravings in Tricity.I love all the braches of Sindhi Sweets due to their services and delicious food.Must try dishes and my personal favorites are1.Chole Bhature2.Pani Puri and Dhai puri3. Cake4. Noodles5.Pav bhaji6. Kaju Katli7. Fresh LadduAnd ofcourse u can pick any sweet or Namkeen and they are the best.I have also tried their grill sandwiches, cake and they all taste amazing. Cheers For #SindhiSweetsTeam sector 11 Panchkula.
Sindhi sweet as known for sweets.Most delicious  and quality is superb.i love laddo barfi which is awesome.Must try.Enough parking area and sitting and dinning is superb.

Place beautiful but lighting is dim so if u r a dim light lover u can go here, food is average some stuff is gud some is nt tht gud but I still love Anupam sweets more than sindhi sweets. Parking space is available it's near or on the road u can dine or take away easily.

Very bad experience, money value is zero. Went after watching advertisements in newspaper poori with petha and aloo and in actual they are serving chhole instead on petha. It took me 46 minute to get my order that too at last when i asked them i will wait only for 1 minute or i will go then they brought it. Manager, cashier staff was clueless what’s going on. In front of manager after scolding him i asked the new to be customers to not order anything as they are taking so much of time, the manager was not interested in asking them to stay or consoling us to not to do so. Pathetic experience, very bad staff and management is zero.
Nice restaurant for food.Tasty and fresh food.Not very expensive.Chana bhatura veg thali and falooda kulfi are my favourite here.
Grt place, quality food, best service

Too spicy food... Inspite of telling them to less spicy for kid's...
Food taste is also average

Ordered Chana Bhatura with Pineapple Raita. Chana Bhatura was fine but quantity was too little. Worst experience with Pineapple Raita, it was just Meethi dahi with a Piece of Pineapple piece over it. Also ordered Chilly Garlic Noodles, which was loaded with Oil.

Pani puri and Dahi puri were average in taste. It can be improved.
Butter paneer and Garlic Naan was good and can be recommended.
Stinking Basement in Sector 37 with dirty and stained floors. Had Chana bhatura with lassi. Best not to have it again. Thank God did not fall sick.

Sindhis has always been one of my favorites for sweets, quick snacks and dining in once in a while.This Sindhis in Panchkula sector 11 is centrally located. Very well stocked and always great quality products. The restaurant offers a variety of options too.There could be a challenge in finding a parking spot inside the market area; so avoid driving inside if you see too many cars. Better to park along the road if you see other cars parked roadside.
I love the food and the ambience and service too but i would  love to suggest to add brownie wth ice cream  and hot chocolate fudge

This is my 1st experience. In manu there are  many items to eat. And they are very tasty.But in my second time I ordered Dal halwa it's not good as much as I eat before . And also Dhai gol gappe it's like Items are not fresh. They have good sitting area but they are not good in food.

Very Nice ExperienceClean, Very Nice sitting areaFood was well madeNot too spicy as you mostly expect when eating outside 😜Service was fast and courteousPricing genuineOnly reason I am giving 4starts for food is to motivate them to brainstorm and make it even better.
Nice ambience..however snacks and dry fruits are in little bit high price...quality wise very good

The restaurant has a cozy and inviting atmosphere, and the staff was incredibly friendly and attentive.
Also the food was amazing.
Loved the place as I usually go there when I get hunger cramps . I love veg hakka noodles and Manchurian à lot

Awesome place for family get together. Tasty Food specially some items without onion and garlic. Good Service by staff. Mr. Bavender Parsad (Restaurant Manager) and His staff is welcoming and always with a smile.

Excellent service alongwith value for money food.
Have developed a cordial rapport with staff, specifically Suraj ji, whose hospitality just enhances the overall experience and make us feel at home. Thank you.

Gr8 food... Gr8 service...

Special mention to Mr. Naresh... He took gr8 effort to make our dining experiance a memorable one.
It was a really great experience  with high quality food and really good service.

Hello ppl, pls don't buy Special Dodha barfi from sindhi, Poor taste for 600rs kg.The mixture of ghee & khoya not upto the standardsThis is not a proper Khoya, tastes like rabri mixOm sweets (Delhi NCR) specialists of Dodha barfi giving at 400rs kg price#unchidukaanfeekapakwaan

Ordered chana bhatura and rajkachori. Quality was not good as it used to be...as I visited so many times before.
Chana kulcha aalo sabzi was like in Puri aalo plate. Chana taste was also flat.
Rajkachori shell was hard and dry. Hope the manager will check it.

Somehow I got to know about this New Sindhi’s franchise opened at Panchkula. Thought of trying it and it turned out to be awful. The service sucks, the cleanliness was worst and the food was tasteless. This is very hard for me to digest such a renowned brand is getting destroyed just because people who own these franchisees are depleting it day by day.

Nice ambience and food is awesome. Had rajma rice and masal dosa. Both were great.
Kesar ras malai was average.
Service is too notch.
One of the biggest Sweet and Restaurant in Tricity. 101℅ pure and Veg 💚. You should visit this place with your family and friends.

Decent but better options available nearby

Vegetarian options: Pure veg restaurant

One of the finest sweet shop chain in north india. They have a great rasgullas other sweets are just fine like others nothing extraordinary. Kachori, pakoras are great too. Golgappa and chat is average. Coming to restaurant section: great dosa, average bhaturas, good manchurian but pathetic noodles. Last time as well i asked specifically that don’t put too much oil but i guess they don’t listen. In overall i will go again for dosa for sure.
I had my team party over there but yes quite overpriced and food was fine but with low quantity
I asked a staff member about washroom and he directed me towards it very politely. I've never eaten here before but atmosphere is really good.

I always wanted this place to be in pkl after chd. Got sick of standard outing places in pkl.Pros:1. Huge dining space in sec 11 showrooms.2. Good quality has always been plus for sindhi foodies.3. Food pure veg.4. Nice place to dine out with family5. Pocket friendly.Cons:1. Parking space less.Overall good place. Suggest to visit

Very poor service , slow service and for tawa roti waiter said to take 15 mints or half hour and after asking him he said new worker is hired but then brought in less time so it's so much confusing for customer...Improve waiting and service time both...
One of the best places to dine with family… we would like to thank Mr Naresh for excellent hospitality and fine dining experience
O dear! This place is best to eat with your loved ones! Great Atmosphere 🥂
Taste, quality of restaurant food not stable......... water used should be good causes stomach problems sometimes

Good quality food, high quality sweets, restaurant food taste is good but not the best, prices are on higher side.Vegetarian options: All vegetarian and good qualityParking: Difficult to find parking most of the times
Great ambience.. Great food.. Very nice and polite staff.. Great experience 😊😊
Food was fine, service could hv been better. The masala dosa filling is spicy, do keep in mind.

Best place for corporate dining.we have been bringing our clients for dinner and lunch ...Excellent staff..Nareshji leaves no stone unturned in serving our clients..very happy with experience....!!! Good food good staff
Have been a regularly visiting Sindhi Sweets in Sector 17 Chandigarh since I was a kid. Love their variety in snacks n sweets. So glad that they opened up an outlet in Panchkula.
Fungus got in dry fruit patisha within 4 days despite keeping in fridge.

We had such a great dinner followed by our last dish Haka noodles. Extreme raw onions ruined the dish and it's sharpness brought tears to eyes and bitter Onion taste . Reported to Naresh and he was very argumentative and ruined our whole dinner experience. No help. Not coming again
One of the Best in the city, don't think once before going here for breakfast, lunch or dinner.
Masala dosa, chana bhatura... And what not all are waooooo....  They have their own flavor..
Pathetic behaviour of Mr Naresh and all the the staff … very bad experience. They just don’t know how to talk … very Rude behaviour
Very nice service and food service staff 👌 very frequently ultimate recipes service is keep it up 😃 specially suraj captain very successful captain 👍 in panchkula outdated

The place is situated in Sector 11 market Panchkula. The ambience is amazing. The restaurant is also a sweet shop at the entrance with a lot of variety of sweets , chocolates and gift packs. The food was amazing and well served. Seating is no problem and is abundant. Recommended for future visits

Had a very happy moments with my family when came for dinner.

Vegetarian options: I recommend this place for all my near and dear ones.This is better than Anupam in all respects.

We have been coming to Sindhi sweets panchkula since opening.We are always greeted and personally attended by Mr.Naresh ji who always makes sure we have a pleasant and fulfilling experience. We would highly recommend sindhi sweets to all.
Very poor service… it took 30mins after placing order to reconfirm order and still they said we are preparing and again it takes 30mins to again confirm that order is prepaid or not…..
Mr aditya gud staff best staff we are from karnal happy with customer service

Food is awesome and I recommend it for tasy food items , atmosphere is also good, what I noticed or you can say dont like is suddenly a big rat ran from the main kitchen to directly our table, which I think they should take care for hygenic part.Two times waiters dropped the plates kept on the counter.So on some points they nees improvements otherwise food is must try.
Another great dining experience with sindhi, in a relatively new outlet! Food was good but you need to wait for a table! Service is on slower side as compared to other outlets! Good for once in time!

The place is one of the most popular for dine in around the area and is very busy during the weekends. Wait times are not that high, food quality and taste is consistent across their chain and most of the items have a tinge of sweetness given the sindhi cuisine. Service suffers at times given the kind of rush they have, but the servers do their best.
Good food cool atmosphere and quick service. Quality of food is really good

A big shop for sweets, snacks, biscuits, cakes, juices.
We came here for delicious Doda barfee. Also try 'Kheer Kadam'.
One of the best place for eating chaat and kulfi.Even mithai's are tasty.A must visit if you come to Panchkula.Service is also good.👌
Excellent staff and food. We would thank Naresh ji for his hospitality in giving us a good food experience.
Awesome place to have a good family or friend time with good food containing no extra oil .
Our favorite place for family dinner..amazing food..service was superb from Mahesh.
Food is good and staff behaviour is very cordial. Must visit.
Samosa... goodDal kachori.. goodEspresso coffee... very goodChutneys... goodFrench fries.. averageBread pakora... average
Ur serving staff is good but specially Naresh ji is extra ordinary .

Delicious food 😋 best setting arrangement
Love Sindhi sweet

For people like me coming from the US, this is a treat. Although we get all Indian snacks in the US, the quality and taste here is so different and good.
Comfort food.

Chole bhature worth a try.... Amritsari kulcha more like aloo paratha

Quality of mithai is not as good as it used to be
Good for large gatherings and family dinners. Very good kids friendly menu.

A great place to hang out with your friends, colleagues and family. Great food and the best part is that they have even started serving biscuits with this tasty masala tea which gives it an additional taste.
Top quality bakery products , neat and clean ambience. Good place to visit
The food is  good  and great place  and  the  staff is soft- spoken especially shashi paul and especially chana bhatura is very tasty 😋
Sindhi sweets restaurant is very good the chana bhatura there is very tasty and  curd Manipuri  and the staff was also very cooperative, especially Shashi Paul !

Food is ok, but the senior staff is very rude. I called them for a table booking as our guests were more than 10, I talked to two different people and both were very rude. They didn't have even basic etiquettes to talk and were not even concerned about any booking. Very bad experience, was not expecting this from Sindhi Sweet, Sector 9, Pkl. So I got my booking done at some other place.
Nothing can beat over taste and quality when compare to Sindhi Sweets. Great Eating place with top quality of food. Pure vegetarian!!
We have been bringing our corporate  clients for lunch and dinner.Mr Naresh here provides us with best service which helps us to serve our clients .
The ambience is good.. service is a little slow and the menu is good  as per the price but thalis are really not good as per taste. One can go for the Chinese dishes. Those are 😋.
Nice place for sweets and namkeen. Fast food and dine in.
Crowded area, Food quality is best, Free parking available.

Undoubtedly the best place in Panchkula for top quality Indian sweets and snacks.Tried their restaurant with family and ordered golagappas, kulfi falooda, hot coffee, bhelpuri and dosa.Best kulfi falooda ever eaten in my life; amazing. Hot coffee, and golagappas were also outstanding. Dosa was average. Bhelpuri was good.Strongly recommended for Indian snacks and mithai.Wheelchair accessibility: Not wheelchair friendly. You need to climb atleast 10 steps
Service was great and food is excellent too highly recommend 🤟🤟
So yummy food must try chilli potatoes too ymm so good  👍
Excellent service and food was too yummm.
Sec-11 Panchkula. Very nice place with great arrangements and food 🍱🍲🌯🌮

Cakes were lil expensive and quantity and finishing was also not so appealing. Sweets  variety was good. Fine in area is also available which looks fresh with green grass. The quality of food was fine. The carpet area is enough to move properly. Display of sweets and other items are done fantasticallyVegetarian options: Bhalla papdiTikkiGol gappeParking: Parking area is Lil busy in evening time.Kid-friendliness: Many options are available for kidsWheelchair accessibility: Yes
It was ok ok . They dont kniw how to make filled golgappas. Not tasty .

Poor quality..After requesting for less salt food also they add salt in too much quantities… no preferences are considered even on requesting …Dissatisfied in all terms …Vegetarian options: Gol gappe, Gobhi Manchurian , dosa

If you are loking for a good quality pure veg restaurant and sweet shop then look no further. Sindhi Sweets located in sector 11 Panchkula offers a decent place to eat at. Their dahi papdi is a must try. Gilgappas were below expectation though. The oreo shake can also be tried. The sweets are amazing.Vegetarian options: Everything on the menu is vegetarian
Very good family restaurant. Famous for its special ladoos. Jain food is also available. Service is up to mark. The restaurant and its staff is good and welcoming.
Excellent food, excellent quality, excellent service and pleasent and soothing environment.

Ordered more than 5 dishes... Pizza was totally burnt but the chef did not accept his mistake. Also Amritsari kulcha was just elongated aloo parantha :( Expected a lot more from brand such as Sindhi Sweets.

Visited Sindhi sweets for dinner with family. We had to wait initially for over 30 minutes to get a table for the dining area, the self service area was open though.They have a decent menu covering Indian, Chinese, Italian and South Indian food. Highly recommend their kulcha, Chole, aloo tiki dahi and fall makhani.The desserts too are wonderful here and a must try.

The quality of the sweets sold by Sindhi Sweets is amazing. With a large variety of sweets you are likely to find most kinds of sweets. The price is on the higher end though. They have a restaurant as well but serve only Veg. The service staff is well behaved and polite.

Lots of variations of sweets, which are so delicious & yummm. We visited restaurant too and had mouth watering dinner with our family.One of the finest sweet shop chain. Kachori, pakoras are great too. Golgappa and chat is average. Great dosa, bhaturas, good manchurian but not happy with noodles. In overall i will go again for dosa for sure.
Ohh..Lot of sweet items...but Dhoda Barfi is special one ... स्वच्छ ,  सुंदर एवं  शुद्ध दुकान।
Ambience is no doubt great, food choices are good and tastewise also very nice but service is little bit down, being less rush the order took time to arrive. The food prices are pocket friendly.
Food quality is very very poor.Salt is very high in all dishes.Pls do not come at this place for food.Totally wastage of money.Vegetarian options: Na
Mr. Naresh was very helpful as I reached at odd lunch time with my family members.

Nice restaurant and sweet shop. Lots of seating capacity. But one negative issue is voice resounds and reverberations are felt due to non sound absorbing walls of the restaurant.  Good menu but steep prices.
Staff are rude while taking orders and food are not good, we found cockroch in dal.Vegetarian options: The one who likes cockroaches can go to eat them.

Very unprofessional staff. They don't know how to talk to customers.
Passing vulgar and rude comments. Asking personal questions

Ordered veg biryani and cappuccino. Veg biryani was tasteless and 10-15 dal chini pieces were their i one plate serving. Please change the chef or just tell him that dal chini is a strong masala and is for flavor not to chew.And plus the coffee was very strong, if i wanted a strong one , could have ordered espresso.Poorest and tasteless meal i had.

It looks good luxurious and premium but while tasting a sweet I realised that it was not good completely dry and taste was not to the expectation.Food which they serve in dinning is quite good  but price is very high. Due to which one can't visit frequently here.In short it looks good but not that good in terms of things they provide. Make choise wisely..

To start with the ambience: absolutely divine for a sweet cum restaurant. Elegant.Staff: 5*Food is just amazing: i tried south Indian, Punjabi, tandoori starters. Every dish is really delicious. For vegetarian, it's really a good choice.
The waiter was confused and spill the ras of ras malai we ordered.

One of the best vegetarian food 😋 👌

Vegetarian options: Pure vegetarian good atmosphere
Good food
Sindhi sweet is good as compared to their competitors in Tricity. They should work on the staff’s training though as they are not responsive and need to learn customer service skills.
V poor quality of sweets. Ordered these gulab jamun they taste stale and dry.

Very nice place for family dinner and lunch
Nice staff
Good food

Makki roti sarson saag excellent taste,super
Way of packing
.

If i could have option, i definitely give minus rating. The man in cake section is such a rude that he think we r taking stuff free from them. He dont have manner to talk to the customer. Cake  was delivered to us was entirely different than that we ordered. At the laat moment of fuction , we have to compromise as no.option was left with us. Rather than feeling sorry, the person at cake counter was talking rubbish and rude. I strongly advice the authority of Sindhi to look into the matter and direct the person to have some manner while dealing with customer because they are paying for the stuff. Really feeling bad...

Thought of trying Sindhi panchkula first time with family..Chole bhature were pathetic..means no taste of chole ,they were sweet as hell..aloo subzi again was tasteless..the thali presentation was extremely poor..had to ask for pickle to eat bhature...Other members ordered Masala Dosa and they had the same feedback regarding Dosa taste and quality...Then and there only I told the waiter that don't the chef taste its own product to see what he has made or some person responsible for food quality...it looked he went inside to communicate the but never responded back to me..I will never visit Sindhi again ...

One of the best places to have sweets and other condiments in and near the Tricity. Anyone who stays near or in Chandigarh definitely knows Sindhi Sweets, so they are popular and already have a well-deserved reputation. A must-visit for sweet lovers
Food is yummyI loved the sindhi special dosaDahi balla needs to be softSweets are delicious

Food quality is average. However, the restaurant itself is pretty good looking.
The service staff isn't particularly quick and attentive to customers' needs.

My cousin visited yesterday for lunch
Found cockroach in food in Sindhi sweet panchkula its pathetic

Very very poor packing of sweets. Sweets are good but it is of no use if presentation is poor. No one is there to take care of workers. There is lot of confusion in the shop. No one from owner side is available at the shop. This shop is working on the behalf of workers. I repent everytime I go there. Sometimes overconfidence is bad.

Waiting time is always long. Food is good but some of the food items end much before in the day. Kids wanted kulfi faluda eagerly and we went for dinner at 8pm. 830 they told kulfi Faluda has ended. They should tell earlier if food items have ended.Vegetarian options: Good

The staff and manager of Sindhi sweet s is very careless and arrogant. On 20th Jan 2023 I bought few sweets of small value ie Rs 400 and somehow forgot to carry the packet after payment. Being resident of Yamunanagar i went again on 23rd Jan to remind them regarding the issue, the manager and relavant staff ignored me and shown attitude like as i was demanding something non genuine thing and asking something from dem free of cost…After observing their such rude behaviour i immediately left the store…To be very genuine and honest I won’t take sweets of Rs 400/- free of cost deliberately….

Sindhi never fails to impress.. a budget friendly , tasty option for any family outing. The peculiar feature about this newly opened outlet is is ambience.  It looks amazing 👏. Onemust definitely order noodles here because they are just too yum. Hope they maintain their legacy further.
Very delicious sweets as well snacks. From Surat and specially visited to have Rajma chawal.
Always Sindhi panchkula offers wonder sweets and food. They are fresh and served in a nice way. Would recommend Sindhi over other nearby sweet shops for sure. Keep up the good work.

It's a nice place. Better among the Sindhi outlets in the TriCity. Food is fresh and tasty.
Kids friendly customisations are easy and service is good.
Must try!

The newly opened sweet shop of Sindhi sweets is not up to any standard. The shop is crowded with a lazy staff. The preparation of sweets is ordinary. The shop is charging Rs 100 onwards for the sweet boxes made of card paper which is pure fleecing of consumers. The restaurant is very congested and poorly lighted. The taste of sweets and dishes is just ordinary. Sindhi sweets needs a wake up call. Not recommended at all.

A decent family restaurant, you can assume the average cost per person for dining is 300-400rs.Sweets- GoodSnacks - GoodNorth Indian - GoodSouth Indian-averagePizza, pastas and burgers - Not recommended

Pretty average place. Over dated.Had chole bhature and poori.Qty - 2/5 Chole are too less.Taste - 2/5Ambiance - 4/5.In short - not worth time and money if you are a foodie. please. Panriyaa please play Saware More Gaana Vishala Karjo Laga Do Ikko DalliParking: Available

This cozy restaurant has left the best impressions! Nice taste in north and south Indian food, wonderful dessert and the mithai section was wonderful. The diwali sweets boxes decoration and taste are wonderful, I recommend to everyone! I would like to come back here again and again.
Amazing sweet shop ,their Rasmalai is mouth waterinh😍😍🤗

Ambience is great, perfect for family dine in. We just customised a standard thali by replacing dal with chana masala and they did it, i appreciate the flexibility. Food taste is decent, but can always be made better😇😇

Sindhi Sweets is a well known out-let in tricity.
This place is mostly crowded. The place is good for its hygiene and services. But i found that place a little bit pricey according to other brands. And the the taste of food was also above average.

I had eaten at Sindhi in Chandigarh through my childhood, so when this place opened up, I really wanted to try it. Place is excellent for sweets and good for meals. There was a bit of wait for the table. We tried chole Bhature, bedmi poori, executive thali and few ala carte dishes. Food was good overall, though we didn't like bedmi poori. Overall a great place. Parking can be tough as there is a lot of crowd always in this area.

sindhi sweets sector 11 is a big fraud. there navratri thali is a big scam. their was nothing in their navratri thali. no paneer no tikki. they dont take care while preparing navratri thali. on talking over phone to mr. naresh of sindhi sweets he said "main kya kar sakta hoon " he had nothing to say. infact he is not knowing abput what is being prepared. now i doubt that onion and garlic is also there in thali. they r doing fraud and playing with sentiments of people. please dont take any navratri food from sindhi.
Good sweet eatery place near lakkad bajar. Should try once 😁

Among best place for eating in sector 11 PanchkulaVegetarian options: Indian and ChineseParking: Some time difficult to find parkingKid-friendliness: Mostly kids liking dishes are availableWheelchair accessibility: Yes
Sweets are very good . Service is poor in the restaurant. They are not able to cater to the large crowd there.

It was weekday when i went there around 4:00P.M.There was no crowd at that time. We sat there for 15 minutes and then they served water to us and asked for order. They took 10-15 to serve that. After that, we have waited for 15 minutes again to place next order. This they served quickly. Again, we have waited for 15 minutes for our bill. We have to go to bill counter to pay the bill. Their people were standing there but not interested in serving the people. I must say they have pathetic customer service.

The ambience is great, I took Rajma chawal thaali for take out, while the rice was loaded, there was v. Little rajma, which was v.disappointing as we had v to eat the rice dry. The proportion was very disproportionate, nd it wasn't value for money. Though it was tasty.Similarly for pao bhaji, we got vLil bhaaji, again a disappointment..The packing charges for take out for rajma chawal was also extra....very disappointed.

They serve stuffed maida naan with channa in the name of Amritsari Kulcha. It is nothing less than a rubber flat bread with aloo pushed inside. And they say it is made like this only. Pls educate urself first.Bhaturas are always soggy.Came here several times but today I call it quits on this place.Google should have option for minus rating.
Very nice place in Panchkula Sector 11, as well as Elante mall also. I visited both places. Food is good, quantity sufficient and atmosphere very cool. May visit.

Entered at 3:30pm and they said it's lil busy we'll get you in, in 20 minutes which is okay but when we ordered the food it was 4 and then they said sorry we can't serve north Indian food as its already 4. The way they were saying no was very very rude. Atleast they can tell us this thing while we were waiting in front of them to get seat. After that we tried other cuisine which was average in taste. Food was at room temperature already. Not planning to go there in future.

Superb Experience as well spectacular ambience. . it way bigger than Sector 8 Sindhi & Sector 17 Sindhi. . The best thing I like about Sindhi is that its being around 25 years + but It has managed to maintain its quality, taste and mouthlicious delicacies. . . Must try place
My favourite place for dining at sector 11 Panchkula

You can come here to have a variety of snacks.
Their cakes are worth trying..

Till today Sindhi Sweets was just OK in my food places list. But today it has entered the top 10 food places in Chandigarh. I was craving for having aloo ki subji n puri today, went to atleast 5 places (including gopal's) but either they serve  it on Sunday only or they just have this dish in their menu. Finally, determined to eat aloo puri for breakfast, I reached Sindhi Sweets and I was blessed. Though they are serving bedmi puri (moong dal puri) with aloo subji n chhole but the dish was good. Perfectly spiced, not so oily and you will not feel stuffed after having it. Hence, 5 starts from my side. Worth trying. 👍👍If anyone can suggest a good place for having aloo puri please do tell in comments.

Good.. But they changed the flavours of some dishes.. And changed process of cooking in case of some dishes.. Some dishes  are too delicious at sindhi sweets.. My favorite one is Gravy with cheese naan.. I lived it.. It's like a family restaurant.. The ambience is too good... No smoking and no alcohol drinking zone..
The food was good however the staff is not trained in hygiene. Just to quote, despite repeated reminders the utensils were dirty and the staff was facilitating with dirty hands.

The food was tasty. Kadhai mushroom was worth trying and amritsari kulcha and butter naan were perfectly baked..Need to look after hygiene as tye stains of oil were there on crockery and glasses were not properly washed and cleaned.
We had coffee.. atmosphere is really cosy

We stopped for quick breakfast on the way to Shimla. We ended up eating extra because of awesome taste.We had bedmi poori which tasted great. Samosa with Tea tastes even better .Their channa bhatura is must try.Ambiance and hospitality were great too.

Very poor service. Staff and manager was very rude. They don't have any manners to talk to their customers. Never recommend. Paneer tika is totally wastage of money and also don't try masala dosa and onion dosa. Seriously very bad experience ever in my life. Never recommend sindhi sweets for dinner or anything.

Like all other Sindhi Sweets outlets, you will find an extensive range of mithai, snacks, and gift packs here. But as an addition this outlet has an extensive seating on the ground floor and wedding invitation section downstairs.

Had breakfast today and ordered Bedmi poori and Chole bhature.Really tasty Aalo sabzi and petha sabzi plus very light sugar moong dal halwa.It's very tough to find good Sunday morning breakfast in tricity - Specially (Poori Aalo). Really tasty.Keep up the same quality.
Food was overpriced especially snacksAnd staff was too rude to talk they don’t have basic etiquettes to talk to peopleIn total , a very bad experience

Don't go save money. Food is average.Service is even worst. Nobody cares about you there. You keep sitting 15 mins to get water. Nobody comes to you to ask if you need anything else.Unnecessary loud music for such kind of a restaurant.Dosa and bhature both were cold.On 2nd visit, chaat was also not good.

Went for their highly hyped chana bhatura, believe me the worst chana bhatura Ever had. If their would have been raiting in minus, it would be less.No taste. The aloo sabzi was bland just boiled potatoes with no flavours, Chana sabzi was disappointing with no taste at all.NOT RECOMMEND AT ALL.
Everything is great..must visit place..great hospitality by Mr Mahesh.

Did not have even 1/10th of an experience that is expected when u enter Sindhi SweetsGood things first...sweets are perfect..be it their signature desi ghee ladoos or Bengali sweets everything is perfectHowever the restaurant was not upto the mark...food was okayish(dal makhni was good, paneer was okay..mix vegetable didn't have any salt whereas the cheese naan with gravy was overly salty)the service was pathetic...I was served water in a glass full of lipstick marks (the waiter did get me a fresh glass of water almost after 25 mins.of complaining), the spoons in cutlery stand seemed they were used to enjoy rasgullas earlier😑The orders brought to our table were incomplete ( for example..pickle papad and mix veg were missing from the special thali that was served to us... although they did get us the vegetable n papad when we had finished eating our food)They also completely forgot about the dal roti combo that was ordered along with other items...however brought it after being reminded twice....Hot tandoori and tawa rotis accompanied cold dal,paneer n mix veg.All in all not a good experience...there is a lot to be improved.Two stars only for the sweets n in view of the assurance given by the owner that they will look into everything
Dining is 120% full with people waiting for their turn.

Sindhi Sweets is one the famous brand of Sweets Shop based out of Chandigarh. they have 6/7 outlets in Chandigarh. We had Chola Bhatura , and Normal Thali. Food preparation is out of Desi ghee. There is sitting inside and good waiters to serve.We had left our mobile phone there , and they had kept it with themselves.. Overall one can visit if they want to have Desi snacks and sweets ..

At the starting of restaurant, everything was good - like service and food taste (quality).Now it’s going to really bad.Service poor and taste is totally rubbish.Not worth-to have lunch or dinner here.Ambiance is also smelly.
Best Pithi Puri Sabji in the city

The place is fanciest in the area but lacks many things. The plates were dirty (wiped off with a tissue and thus found out). The food was okay. The noodles were over the top oily (which is why I felt bad afterwards). The condiments tray had dust on it with some spills on top which looked gross so I got rid of it. The pastries are too pricey.

The food is decent but the staff is highly rude here. It was just 2-3 mins we sat on a vacant table when our waiter asked us to shift to another table because the family next to us had guests coming in and thus wanted adjoining tables which is absolutely acceptable but atleast ensure that the table that you're asking us to move to, is clean and tidy. He hastly wiped and went to the family with adjoining tables. Then we took napkins and ourselves started wiping the table and the chairs. As soon as we settled in, within a minute, he came to our table and rudely told us to order as the restaurant is closing soon. If the restaurant was so worried with the timings then the watchman should have stopped us from entering the restaurant itself. We were not welcomed rather we felt insulted. Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.
Good ambience and taste of food was ok. We tried masala dosa, Raj kachori, chole kulche and white sauce pasta but the taste of white sauce pasta was Desi. They don't know how to cook the same.

Is it a little overpriced...I'll let you be a judge of that.Helpful staff, and they allow you to sample some of the stuff.I bought some absolutely excellent gajak and gur moongphali ki chikki. Their potli samosas were okay, imarti sweet was good....tho for a moment I wondered if it was made in ghee, or some refined oil.They have a huge variety of sweets and namkeen etc. Definitely worth a visit.

Undoubtedly one of the worst food experiences in panchkula (and rest of tricity).Ordered three dishes - Raj Kachori, Masala Dosa, Chole bhatureRaj Kachori - Shell was extremely hard to bite into, lacked the chutneys and tanginessMasala Dosa - Ironically didn't have any masala; when asking for more, they deniedCholle Bhature - The first place I have seen which serves cholle bhature without onion. Cholle weren't upto the mark, lacked spicesOverall a pretty bad experience; Not recommended

Dahi balla prepration is worst - 1star
But Soup is Good  -5star
One of the best options for vegetarian people.located in sec 11 panchkula. Very nice ambience with really yumm food.apart from food they have lots of variety n bakery items too..had great time there

Newly opened Sindhi Sweets in Panchkula 11 sector has really disappointed me alot! I have been there with my family and friends. The food as compared to Sindhi's in Elante is ok types, not so good in taste. What annoys here the most is their service. The people serving the food here are so irresponsible, don't even care to listen and take orders. If this type of service continues, the day is not far when this place is gonna shut completely!! The management really needs to pay attention to this branch else these people are spoiling such a good brand like SINDHI!!As of now I don't recommend ANYONE going to Sindhi 11 sector, Panchkula..
Good vibes , beautiful place to visit.

Reached at 3 pm and had ordered snacks and main courseIt served after 20 minutes roughly and started with snacks followed by main courseBut just after serving one basket the waiter stood on our head asking whether we want more chapati or not as it was exact 4 and their chef had to goWe asked to wait for 5 minutes only but he kept asking minute after minuteThey should wait going order to complete
Went for Sunday morning breakfast .Nice ambience and adequate seating .Good menu and preparations.  The fresh lime was too sweet .A worth it experience.  Do taste the sweet Lassi.

A fancy looking store where u get sweets and cookies.It also have a restaurant on ground floor. Which seems ok, nothing great like a restaurant. For quick fast food it seems good.Cleanliness was maintained.Service was ok, however staff was cold in servicing.All in all ok.

Compared to price food was not up to the mark.
There mixed sauce pasta tasted very bad.
Dosa and pau bhaji were ok.
Ambience is nice.
Rasturant is good but waiter tip mange khar jate h.. Already rates itne high h fir bhi tips le rhe h.
Review just for kulfi faluda. Everything was good but it had atleast 4-5 chunks of hard kateera, which ruined the taste completely.

I am the proud first customer of this shop when first opened in 1976 in SCO 47/17E. Neeraj Bajaj was a child at that time. It's unforgettable taste and the same maintanance of quality of those days is still intact. All the best.

Good but tou have to wait for order,sitting and also wait while eating food for next chapati and their staff said sair pls wait 10 minutes for next chapati.
Their elante mall staff is good and their respectfull behaviour is also countable.(all branches are good 5/5 but this branch deserve in behaviour category is 2/5.
Nice place to eat especially with family. Cleanliness, atmosphere, service and food all are amazing.

I ordered only variety of 3 things(Veg. Cutlet, Paneer Pakoda, Vada pao)which was messed up and i realized it after i got back home.The order given to me was Samosa,Paneer Pakoda, Vada Pao.
It has happened the 2nd time

Best part is their moong dal halwa. Worst is that they don't make Jalebi (not in Cosmos mall and one more outlet that i dont remember). As i have been updated, sector 11 Panchkula outlet do make Jalebi on daily basis.
Location is fine and sweets are very good.... we have ordered Rasmalai that was too good
New outlet in sector 11 Panchkula. Clean, hygienic and nicely displayed sweets and snacks. Tasty and fresh. Indian and Chinese cuisine served in the restaurant. Value for money.
